探.definition: to explore; to search out; to scout; to visit; to stretch forward

探井.definition: (mining) test pit; exploratory shaft; test well

探傷.definition: to inspect metal for flaws (using X-ray or ultrasound etc)

探勘.definition: to explore; to survey; to prospect (for oil etc); prospecting

探口氣.definition: to sound out opinions; to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning; also written 探口風|探口风[tan4 kou3 feng1]

探口風.definition: to sound out opinions; to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning

探問.definition: to inquire into; to ask after

探囊取物.definition: to feel in one's pocket and take sth (idiom); as easy as pie; in the bag

探奇.definition: to seek unusual scenery or places

探子.definition: intelligence gatherer; spy; detective; scout; sound (medical instrument); long and narrow probing and sampling utensil

探察.definition: to investigate; to observe; to scout; to seek out and examine; to explore

探尋.definition: to search; to seek; to explore

探幽發微.definition: to probe deeply and uncover minute details

探底.definition: (of stock prices, etc) to slump; to dip

探店.definition: to try out a restaurant and film a video to share on the Internet

探摸.definition: to feel for sth; to grope

探望.definition: to visit; to call on sb; to look around

探查.definition: to examine; to probe; to scout out; to nose around

探案.definition: (of a detective) to investigate a case

探求.definition: to seek; to pursue; to investigate

探班.definition: to check on sb at his workplace; to come to a movie set to visit one of the actors

探病.definition: to visit a sick person or patient

探監.definition: to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)

探看.definition: to visit; to go to see what's going on

探知.definition: to find out; to ascertain; to get an idea of

探礦.definition: to prospect; to dig for coal or minerals

探祕.definition: to explore a mystery; to probe the unknown

探究.definition: to investigate; to delve; to probe; to enquire into; to look into

探聽.definition: to make inquiries; to try to find out; to pry

探花.definition: candidate who came third in the Hanlin examination (cf. 狀元|状元[zhuang4yuan2]); (slang) to secretly film sex with a prostitute to share on the Internet

探視.definition: to visit (a patient, prisoner etc); to look inquiringly

探親.definition: to go home to visit one's family

探訪.definition: to seek by inquiry or search; to call on; to visit

探詢.definition: to inquire into; to ask after

探路者.definition: Pathfinder, NASA spacecraft sent to Mars in 1977

探身.definition: to lean forward; to lean out (of a window, door etc)

探身子.definition: to bend forward; to lean out

探險.definition: to explore; to go on an expedition; adventure

探頭.definition: to extend one's head (out or into); a probe; detector; search unit

探頭探腦.definition: to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)

探頭探腦兒.definition: erhua variant of 探頭探腦|探头探脑[tan4 tou2 tan4 nao3]

探風.definition: to make inquiries about sb or sth; to fish for information

探驪得珠.definition: to pluck a pearl from the black dragon (idiom, from Zhuangzi); fig. to pick out the salient points (from a tangled situation); to see through to the nub
